subject: Fashion
title: Indigo Dyeing History
description: A short lesson to help you apply Indigo Dyeing History.

hook.text: Indigo is the world's oldest dye, used for over 6,000 years.

buildup.text: Ancient Egyptians wrapped mummies in indigo-dyed linen shrouds.

discovery.text: Indigo bonds to the fiber surface, not insideâ€”that's why it fades gracefully.

twist.text: Natural indigo farming collapsed when a synthetic version arrived in 1897.

climax.text: Today synthetic indigo dyes billions of jeans but pollutes waterways.

punchline.text: The world's most loved dye is also one of its dirtiest.
